Remark. The vector spaces Rn,Rn×1,R1×n are only different in the way
we write vectors. In the following, we will not make a distinction between
Rn and Rn×1, which allows us to write n-tuples as column vectorscolumn vector
x=


x1
...
xn

. (2.64)
This simpliﬁes the notation regarding vector space operations. However,
we do distinguish between Rn×1 and R1×n (the row vectors) to avoid con-row vector
fusion with matrix multiplication. By default, we write xto denote a col-
